definitions.definition: To bend (any thin material, such as paper) over so that it comes in contact with itself.
To make the proper arrangement (in a thin material) by bending.
definitions.example: If you fold the sheets, they'll fit more easily in the drawer.

definitions.definition: To become folded; to form folds.
To fall over; to be crushed.
definitions.example: The chair folded under his enormous weight.

definitions.definition: To enclose within folded arms (see also enfold).
To give way on a point or in an argument.

definitions.example: With no hearts in the river and no chance to hit his straight, he folded.

definitions.definition: (by extension) To withdraw or quit in general.
To stir gently, with a folding action.
definitions.example: Fold the egg whites into the batter.

definitions.definition: Of a company, to cease to trade.
definitions.example: The company folded after six quarters of negative growth.

definitions.definition: To double or lay together, as the arms or the hands.
definitions.example: He folded his arms in defiance.

definitions.definition: To cover or wrap up; to conceal.
To confine animals in a fold.
